name: Excel Functions
subtitle: Excel Functions are Fun
description: Excel is more than just columns and rows of data. Excel can perform calculations from simple addition to complex formulas with its vast library of named functions. In this series, we cover everything you need to know about crunching numbers in Excel. There are multiple sections ranging from the very basics to more advanced data analysis to a reference guide of the different Excel functions by category. This series is for beginners as well as advanced users of Excel.
descriptionMD: Excel is more than just columns and rows of data. Excel can perform calculations from simple addition to complex formulas with its vast library of named functions. In this series, we cover everything you need to know about crunching numbers in Excel. There are multiple sections ranging from the very basics to more advanced data analysis to a reference guide of the different Excel functions by category. This series is for beginners as well as advanced users of Excel.

episodes.title: Introduction to Excel Function
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne start their Excel Functions series by laying down some foundational knowledge and terminology. Specific concepts/definitions discussed here includes: Functions, Relative Reference, Absolute Reference, Formula, and Named Ranges.

episodes.title: Basic Formulas
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne introduce you to working with basic formulas in Excel 2016. Specific topics covered here includes: formula format, cell references, running formulas, order of operations, updating formulas, using formulas across worksheets, and common errors.

episodes.title: Basic Functions
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne introduce you to working with basic functions in Excel 2016. Specific topics covered here includes: Navigating the Formulas tab, categories of Functions, Insert Function dialog box, Descriptions of Functions, and Following steps in the Function Dialog box.

episodes.title: Basic Functions Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue their introduction to working with basic functions in Excel 2016. Specific topics covered here includes: Using the AutoSum function, Relative Reference, and Absolute Reference.

episodes.title: Named Ranges
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore working with Named Ranges in Excel 2016 Functions and Formulas. Here they will show you: how to create a Named Range, naming conventions, access the Name Manager, use the Helper, create Named Ranges from a selection, Delete Names, and use Named Ranges in formulas.

episodes.title: 3D Cell Reference
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explain the use of 3D cell references. Here they will specifically show you: Creating 3D cell references, performing 3D calculations, and copying sheet into workbook formulas.

episodes.title: Formula Auditing
episodes.description: Vonne and Zach cover formula auditing, trace cells-precedents & dependents, error checking, evaluate formula, and error checking & types of errors.

episodes.title: SUM
episodes.description: Adding up numbers is one the most commonly used tasks in Excel.  In this episode, Vonne and Justin explore how to use the SUM function, including shortcuts and tricks.

episodes.title: SUMIF
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin explore how to use the SUMIF function. SUMIF adds a range of numbers based on single criteria.

episodes.title: SUMIFS
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin explore how to use the SUMIFS function. SUMIFS adds a range of numbers based on multiple criteria.

episodes.title: COUNT, COUNTA, COUNTBLANK
episodes.description: The COUNT functions are a set of popular functions that, well, count!  In this episode, Vonne and Justin explore how to use the COUNT, COUNTA, COUNTBLANK functions to count numbers (COUNT), any content (COUNTA), and number of blank cells (COUNTBLANK).

episodes.title: COUNTIF, COUNTIFS
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin explore how to use the COUNTIF AND COUNTIFS functions. These functions count the number of occurrences based on a singular (COUNTIF) and multiple (COUNTIFS) criteria.
